steps.title: Consultation and Evaluation
steps.description: Your journey begins with a thorough consultation with Dr. Kunal Sayani, where he will:
items: Assess your medical history and current health status.
Evaluate the extent of breast tissue enlargement.
Discuss your aesthetic goals and expectations.
Determine the most suitable surgical approach.

steps.title: Surgical Techniques
steps.description: Depending on the severity of gynecomastia and individual patient factors, Dr. Sayani may employ one or both of the following techniques:
techniques: Liposuction: Ideal for cases with excess fatty tissue and good skin elasticity. Small incisions are made, and a cannula is used to suction out fat deposits.
Excision: Necessary when glandular breast tissue or excess skin must be removed. Incisions are strategically placed to minimize visible scarring.
steps.additionalInfo: In some cases, a combination of liposuction and excision is utilized to achieve optimal results. Gynecomastia surgery performed by Dr. Kunal Sayani typically involves the following steps:
steps: Anesthesia: The procedure is usually done under general anesthesia or intravenous sedation to ensure patient comfort.
Incision and Access: Small incisions are made in inconspicuous areas such as around the areola or in the natural creases of the chest to minimize visible scarring.

Tissue Removal: Excess glandular breast tissue and fat are carefully excised. In cases where fatty tissue predominates, liposuction may be employed to contour the chest and remove excess fat effectively.
Chest Contouring: The surgeon sculpts the chest to restore a natural, masculine appearance with a flat and toned look.
Closure: Incisions are closed with fine sutures to promote optimal healing and minimal scarring.
steps.note: The entire surgery is typically a day-care procedure, allowing patients to return home the same day. Dr. Kunal Sayani utilizes USFDA-approved, minimally invasive techniques designed to reduce pain and accelerate recovery, ensuring patients regain confidence quickly.

immediatePostOp.title: Immediately After Surgery
instructions: Patients should arrange for transportation home and assistance for the first 24 hours.
A compression garment or surgical vest must be worn continuously for several weeks to reduce swelling, support the new chest contour, and aid healing.
Keep the incision sites clean and dry; follow Dr. Kunal Sayani’s instructions for wound care meticulously.
painManagement: Mild to moderate discomfort, swelling, and bruising are expected and can be managed with prescribed pain medications.
Avoid aspirin or blood thinners unless specifically approved by the surgeon.
activityRestrictions: Avoid strenuous activities, heavy lifting, and vigorous exercise for at least 3 to 4 weeks.
Light walking is encouraged soon after surgery to promote circulation.
Avoid direct sun exposure on scars for several months.
followUp: Attend all scheduled follow-up appointments with Dr. Kunal Sayani to monitor healing progress.
Report any signs of infection (redness, warmth, discharge), excessive swelling, or unusual pain immediately.

firstWeek.title: First Week
instructions: Rest and Limited Activity: Avoid strenuous activities; light walking is encouraged to promote circulation.
Compression Garment: Wear continuously to reduce swelling and support the chest contour.
Pain Management: Take prescribed medications as directed to manage discomfort.
Follow-Up: Attend the scheduled post-operative appointment for assessment and suture removal if necessary.

weeksTwoToFour.title: Weeks 2–4
instructions: Gradual Return to Activities: Resume non-strenuous work and daily activities as tolerated.
Continued Garment Use: Wear the compression garment as advised by Dr. Sayani.
Monitor Healing: Watch for signs of infection or complications and report any concerns promptly.

weeksFourToSix.title: Weeks 4–6
instructions: Physical Activity: Gradually reintroduce exercise, avoiding chest-intensive workouts until cleared by Dr. Sayani.
Scar Care: Begin recommended scar treatments to enhance healing and minimize visibility.

stages.note: Full recovery and final results may take several months, with continued improvement in chest contour and skin elasticity.

risksAndSafety.title: Risks & Safety
risksAndSafety.description: Gynecomastia surgery is generally safe when performed by an experienced surgeon like Dr. Kunal Sayani. However, as with any surgical procedure, there are potential risks:
commonRisks: Temporary or permanent changes in nipple or chest sensation
Scarring, which usually fades over time
rareRisks: Poor wound healing or skin necrosis
Allergic reactions to anesthesia or medications
Need for revision surgery if results are unsatisfactory or complications arise
risksAndSafety.safetyMeasures: Dr. Kunal Sayani emphasizes thorough preoperative evaluation and patient education to minimize risks. His use of advanced, minimally invasive techniques further enhances safety and reduces recovery time.
